name: Andrew Stalker
title: Principal Software Engineer
summary: Principal Fullstack Software Engineer and Army veteran with 10+ years building greenfield products from scratch and scaling them into primary business drivers. Leading a globally distributed 12-engineer team at Liberty Mutual—designing event-driven platforms processing 250K+ req/hour, establishing technical standards adopted across the organization, and achieving zero-downtime releases and 30% faster time-to-market via Agentic AI. Military SIGINT background sharpened the pattern recognition and pressure tolerance behind it all.

experience.title: Principal Software Engineer
highlights: Leading a globally distributed team of 12+ engineers (US and India-based) as technical leader for the Small Commercial product portfolio, owning technical roadmaps and stakeholder alignment while guiding end-to-end delivery of flagship products on a modern stack (Angular/TypeScript + Java/Spring Boot).

Designed and built a cloud-native, event-driven microservices platform handling 250K+ requests/hour at peak; implemented asynchronous listeners for real-time data ingestion from partner APIs, establishing the integration pattern adopted across the organization.
Led a cross-functional Agentic AI pilot, establishing technical standards that reduced time-to-market by 30% and driving adoption across the engineering department.
Shipped multiple products and enhancements across the portfolio (BOP, Commercial Package, Simple BOP, Workers Comp), driving growth while maintaining zero major production disruptions.

Led the cross-functional adoption of the ISO 2026 Classification System, reworking entrenched data models and schemas to support new business lines without disrupting high-volume production workflows.
Foster a culture of quality and continuous learning through code reviews, design discussions, and technical workshops; mentor engineers at all levels with regular feedback and career guidance.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
highlights: Built robust fullstack applications and third-party integrations in Angular and Java/Spring Boot, designing RESTful and event-driven APIs that connected internal systems with external data providers and partner platforms.
Engineered multithreaded and asynchronous Java algorithms for transaction processing and calculation engines, significantly improving throughput and responsiveness for high-volume workflows.
Drove operational improvements including enhanced Datadog monitoring, automated testing pipelines, and deployment automation that improved system reliability and developer velocity.
Mentored junior engineers and led internal workshops on best practices, boosting team-wide adoption of coding standards and test coverage.

experience.title: Software Engineer
highlights: Built Simple BOP from scratch—developed core features for a greenfield product that scaled from concept to the primary growth driver for the small commercial portfolio.
Contributed to migrating legacy systems to modern event-driven microservices, defining technical plans and prototyping solutions that improved extensibility and long-term maintainability.
Designed and built third-party API integrations with caching strategies.

experience.title: Lead Full Stack Web Developer
highlights: Built and maintained Risque, an enterprise infrastructure management suite in C#/ASP.NET with SQL Server; optimized complex SQL queries and delivered responsive web interfaces.

experience.title: Military Service
experience.subtitle: Signals Intelligence Analyst & Cavalry Scout
highlights: Led SIGINT and Reconnaissance teams in high-pressure combat environments, utilizing pattern recognition and real-time data analysis—skills directly applied today to complex system debugging and architectural optimization.
Graduated Basic Leader Course (BLC) as Honor Graduate—a distinction awarded to top-performing NCO candidates based on leadership evaluation, academic performance, and physical fitness.
As a Jumpmaster and Scout Team Leader, managed mission-critical operations where precision and clarity were paramount.
Operation Iraqi Freedom (2006–2008) & Operation Enduring Freedom (2011–2012)

Cloud & Infrastructure: GCP (Cloud Run, Cloud SQL, Cloud Build)

education.field: Computer & Information Technology, Software Engineering Emphasis
education.details: Minor in Communication | Dean's List & Semester Honors
